medical_history.chief_complaint: Upper abdominal pain for two days, malaise.
medical_history.history_of_present_illness: Symptoms began two days ago with upper abdominal pain described as a band across the top of the abdomen, reported as 'like my liver is hurting' and 'unlike anything I've experienced before.' Accompanied by nausea but no vomiting. Denies fever but has experienced chills.
medical_history.past_medical_history: S/p liver transplant for autoimmune hepatitis, borderline personality disorder, organic affective syndrome, history of opiate abuse, alcohol abuse, type 2 diabetes mellitus, hypertension, post-traumatic stress disorder, s/p cholecystectomy, sciatica.
medical_history.family_history: Father had a massive CVA, mother has diabetes mellitus.
